result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.
Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.

1:15 PM Defendant Thomas Wesley Springfield in court.  Attorney Randall Walter Petrouske II in court for Thomas Wesley Springfield.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at. Atty Petrouske indicates waiving prelim.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
No violent contact direct or indirect with M.F.

10:32 AM Defendant Thomas Wesley Springfield in court.  Attorney Randall Walter Petrouske II in court for Thomas Wesley Springfield.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Court addresses request for bond modification.  Defense requests no contact condition be lifted. State objects, makes statement. Atty Petrouske makes statement. Victim makes statement. Court amends bond condition from no contact to no violent contact with M.F.  All other conditions remain as previously set.
No Contact Modification Request.
Bail/bond hearing on September 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant's Motion for Modification of Bond.      Court will not hear motion until victim has gone through the protocol at HELP of Door County.
